page.title: 13Grand Union Canal (CONT)
page.content: THE GREAT INFLATABLE BOAT RACE took place on Sunday 10th June 1985.There were 163 teams of 4 people who paddled along seven miles of the Grand Union Canal from the Cow Roast Marina near Tring to the Fishery Inn at Boxmoor. The crews were from local clubs and pubs and were often sponsored in aid of their chosen charity.75 per cent of the crews finished although some were sunk and there was the usual tipping up to add to the excitement. The winners were the crew from the 'Three Blackbirds' pub at Boxmoor.They had a record beating time of 116 mins.42 secs. On a more practical level the canal at Bourne End acts as the effluent point for the local sewage works.This is a fully automated works.Which serves Tring Station,Berkhamsted,Northchurch and Wiggington.
